name: Viking Hotell Tromso

reviews.text: This is a fantastic little hotel (there are also several apartments). Everything in the centre is around 5-10 minutes walk away, the Cable Car a little further if you walk over the bridge or you can take a bus. Rooms are small, with not much storage space, but more importantly for me going in Winter, they are very warm with an individually controlled heater in the room. Bathrooms are fab with heated floor tiles and modern shower and fittings. Everything very clean. Breakfast is included and has the usual range of bread, cheese, ham, fish, boiled eggs, muesli, juice etc. Tea and Coffee are free in reception all day - a very nice touch. Now for the best part ... the Staff are outstanding! Incredibly helpful and friendly, nothing is too much trouble and they will make sure you have a wonderful stay. They were a great help to us recommending bus routes, activities etc (as others have mentioned, a bus ride on the island is a very nice way to get a tour of your surroundings). Tromso familie park (about 40 mins by bus) was also fun. Lots of different animals that can be petted and horses that offer rides for children in summer - just check the bus timetables as they are often infrequent at the weekend.
reviews.title: 3 Star Hotel with 5 Star staff, very friendly and cosy

reviews.text: The reception area is a great place to speak with the staff, either to pick their brains for info or just to learn a little more about the area. Very cosy and the drinks at the bar are reasonably priced. They also offer a discount at a restaurant just down the road for a set price dinner with coffee included for 125 Krone. Excellent value and the guy who makes the coffees has a real passion for it, so you can taste some unusal blends.
reviews.title: Nothing spectacular but does what it says on the tin!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Viking Hotel in Feb 2010. The room was quite small but you’re not there to stay in yr room all the time right. The room fitted 1 single bed on one side of the room and a desk and a chair on the other side with just enough space to walk in between. The toilet, shower and sink are a wet room. Not much storage space but like me I guess just keep yr stuff in yr case and bring stuff that doesn’t need ironing. Breakfast was adequate – selection of meats, fruits, cheese spreads, fish spreads, boiled eggs, salmon, bread and cereal to choose from. Juices and the usual Tea and coffee also available.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Tromso with even better hotelier!

reviews.text: We had a family room with four beds. It was clean, smart and warm (even at -15 C outside!). The bathroom was brilliant. Self-service breakfasts were ample with a typical continental/Norwegian flavour.
The proprietor was very helpful, friendly and attentive, and spoke very good English. We booked entirely by email, then paid with credit card on arrival.
reviews.title: loved the viking hotel Tromso- budget accomodation

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights after arriving by the Hurtigruten ship from Bergen - we came to Tromso in hopes of seeing the northern lights. This hotel is clean and conveniently within walking distance (or bus ride to the Arctic Cathedral) of most places one would want to go to while visiting Tromso. It is not a 4- or 5-star hotel but comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

description: Viking Hotel and Apartments offers accomodation for any guests in any situations. Single and double hotelrooms in traditional ways that includes a nice breakfast, though in a rather small breakfastarea. New and very popular apartments with 1-4 bedrooms, fully furnished and with kitchens ready to use as you wish (breakfast not included). Free internet access from both hotelrooms and apartments. Our serviceminded staff is always present in the lobby, offering our guests free coffee and tea :)
